meanings.definition: Unable to be expressed in words.
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the sunset was unsayable.
meanings.sent2: Her joy was unsayable when she saw her family after a long time.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unsayable attempt to catch its tail made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unsayable love between the two characters was evident in every glance.
meanings.sent5: The unsayable pain in his eyes told a story of its own.

meanings.sent1: The secret was unsayable, locked away in her heart.
meanings.sent2: The unsayable truth finally came to light, shocking everyone.
meanings.sent3: The unsayable joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The unsayable fear gripped her heart, paralyzing her in place.
meanings.sent5: The unsayable mystery of the old house intrigued the children.
